conclusion: Understanding the problem setup with three hemispherical bodies A, B, and C.
Description of masses and placement of bodies A, B, and C.
Details about radii, friction coefficient, and gravitational acceleration.
Objective to find normal force F and frictional force f.
Visualizing setup with A and B on the ground and C between them.
Confirmation from image that C is on top of A and B.
All bodies are hemispherical with radius R.
Start analyzing forces on each body.
Forces on C include weight mg and normal reactions N_A and N_B.
C is in equilibrium, so N_A + N_B = mg.
Forces on A include its weight mg, normal reaction F from ground, and N_A from C.
No force from B on A as they are just touching.
Vertical equilibrium for A gives F + N_A = mg.
Horizontal force on A is zero due to symmetry and smooth contact.
Reconsidering horizontal component from N_A.
Normal reaction from A to C is inclined due to geometry.
Considering geometry with centers O1, O2, and O3.
Distance between O1 and O2 is 2R.
Center O3 of C is above midpoint between O1 and O2.
Visualizing cross-section to better understand placement.
